projects.title: Worth Home Shopify Theme
projects.description: Worth Home needed a complete theme makeover for their unqiue business case: they sell two similar, but un-related products on worthhp.com. The challenge was creating custom home, product, and landing pages to elegantly display both product lines while providing a great UX. We achieved this by toggling content on the homepage, dependant on a user selection and using metafields to determine what content the product pages are populated with.

projects.title: LitJoy Crate - Custom Landing Page
projects.description: LitJoy create is a project I was able to work on at Tako. This was a collaboration between 3 developers, designers and the project management team. My main contribution was to create a landing page that was highly customizable based on the needs of that quarter's book release. The template empowers the client to change everything from font, just about every color on the page, still images or video, toggling sections, and more. I also was able to work on the Klaviyo integration as well as components on other pages around the site.

projects.title: WineHub
projects.description: My capstone project from the UPenn LPS Web Development Bootcamp: WineHub is a marketplace that allows retailers to upload / manage product inventory and consumers to search, filter and purchase from a marketplace to find their perfect wine. There is both a consumer and retailer portal, connected to a common inventory database as well as a built from scratch shopping cart component. In addition to the technologies listed below we used a Redux like structure with Context, ESLint, Passport, Morgan, and Cloudinary Media Hosting. My responsibilities were the backend inventory portal, database work, integrating Stripe and building out the Shopping cart from scratch.

projects.title: Sortly + ShipStation Connection
projects.description: The client needed a solution to be able to connect their inventory management system, Sortly, with their shipping solution, ShipStation. Node was used to build a piece of middleware to pull any changed entries in Sortly and complile the changed product info to be uploaded in Shipstation.

projects.title: Student Directory
projects.description: The student directory was one of our first React mini projects for the Penn Bootcamp. It features sortable columns (on click) and the ability to search by student name.
